security_audit.summary: All 418 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate module scaffolding tool using bash scripts and template substitution. The static analyzer misidentified documentation examples, relative imports, and template placeholders as security issues.

content.user_title: Create feature modules with standardized structure
content.value_statement: Manually creating feature modules requires following complex architecture patterns and naming conventions. This skill automates module creation with proper TypeScript interfaces, barrel exports, and quality standards enforced through validation.
actual_capabilities: Scaffolds new feature modules following 6-folder architecture
Generates TypeScript components with proper I-prefixed interfaces
Creates barrel exports (index.ts) for clean imports
Validates module structure against quality standards
Supports adding components to existing modules
limitations: Designed for DevPrep AI project structure specifically
Module names must use lowercase-with-hyphens format
Does not modify existing files beyond barrel exports

best_practices: Plan module scope before scaffolding using the brainstorming skill
Use descriptive module names that reflect business domain
Run validation after scaffolding to ensure quality compliance
anti_patterns: Scaffolding modules with non-standard names breaks validation
Skipping validation leads to inconsistent architecture
Modifying generated templates without understanding impact

faq.question: What naming formats are required?
faq.answer: Module names use lowercase-with-hyphens. Component names use PascalCase. Interfaces use I prefix.

faq.question: Where are modules created?
faq.answer: Modules are created at frontend/src/modules/<module-name> following the 6-folder architecture.

faq.question: Can I customize the templates?
faq.answer: Yes, edit templates in templates/ directory to change generated code patterns.

faq.question: What validation checks are performed?
faq.answer: Validation checks directory structure, file size limits, I-prefix interfaces, no 'any' types, and import patterns.

faq.question: How do I delete a module?
faq.answer: This skill creates modules only. To remove, delete the module directory manually and update imports.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: Uses Read, Write, Bash, and Glob tools for file operations and script execution.
